attributes.action: Reinstate Gynaecology ward in singleton hospital and abolish mix sex wards.
attributes.additional_details:
I had my operation Wednesday and due to the surgical team looking after me a lot of my notes: bloods and also the information I should of received  wasn't provided due to gynae expecting surgical to provide it and vice versa.
Having a gynaecology operation is such an emotional thing and you really need a team of nurses and Drs who are specialised in that area to provide the patients with the care and dignity they need.
attributes.background: Having recently had a hysterectomy I was appalled to find out that there is now no gynaecology ward in singleton hospital and that all gynaecology operations are now being done on a mixed sex ward.  Women are vuneral after having such a personal operation and shouldn't be around male patients.

rejection.details:
Ward arrangements in specific hospitals are the responsibility of the hospital's management and the local NHS Trust, not the UK Government or Parliament.

We could accept a petition asking the Government to introduce a requirement that all women undergoing gynaecology operations in NHS hospitals in England must be cared for in single-sex wards.
